img.alt: MSD Pike Closed for 2019-2020 school year

div.style: background-image: url('/userfiles/115/my files/new website photos dec 2018/screen shot 2019-01-02 at 9.48.08 pm.png?id=8052');

div.p: In Pike Township we have an incredible school community that is fully invested in our mission to “cultivate a diverse, innovative learning environment by opening doors of opportunity for students to achieve their maximum potential”. This investment can be seen through a variety of local partnerships, the academic initiatives and experiences, and a staff that works diligently to provide a world-class education. Pike High School’s 93% graduation rate and IDOE recognition as an “A” school makes us #PikeProud of our accomplishments.!function(d,s,id){var js,fjs=d.getElementsByTagName(s)[0],p=/^http:/.test(d.location)?'http':'https';if(!d.getElementById(id)){js=d.createElement(s);js.id=id;js.src=p+"://platform.twitter.com/widgets.js";fjs.parentNode.insertBefore(js,fjs);}}(document,"script","twitter-wjs");

span.p: ¿Qué es el Censo? Según el mandato del al Constitución de los Estados Unidos, el censo es un recuento de todas las personas que viven en el país, y que se realiza una vez cada década. Cuando sabemos cuántas personas viven en tu comunidad, las organizaciones y las empresas están major equipadas par evaluar los servicios y programas necesarios, cómo por ejemplo clínicas, escuelas y carreteras. El censo también determina como se distribuyen los escaños en el Congreso entre los 50 estados. En marzo de 2020, la Oficina del Censo de Estados Unidos enviará a cada hogar una invitación para completer un sencillo cuestionario sobre quién vive en tu dirección el 1 de abril. Tendrás la oportunidad de responder en linea, por teléfono o por correo, y la ley federal mantiene esas respuestas seguras y protegidas.
Dale forma a tu futuro. Empieza aquí. Visita 2020CENSUS.GOV

a.title: Click to read more about: What is the 2020 Census?

span.p: Realizing Your Dream Scholarship Application deadline has been extended! The Scholarship Application and supporting documentation must be submitted by Friday, May 15, 2020, to the Canvas assignment created by Ms. Irwin. For access to the PHS Canvas course, click on the "College & Career" icon. This will take you to the CCRC page, where you will find an assignment named "Realizing Your Dream Scholarship Submission Portal." This location is where you will upload the application and all supporting documentation by the deadline. Ms. Irwin, CRC/Graduation Coach a@PikeHighSchool, will forward all applications to the Superintendent's office. Note: It is imperative to complete all categories listed on the application form. The omission of information in any area will disqualify your application.

a.title: Click to read more about: Scholarship Application Due Date Extended

span.p: Governor Holcomb closed Indiana schools until the end of the 2019-2020 school year. We are monitoring the situation closely and provide regular updates at https://www.pike.k12.in.us/Content/pike-covid-19-coronavirus-info- . In the meantime, we will continue to work with and follow the guidance of local and national experts.

ul.li: Our pandemic plan is currently implemented.
Learning continues in MSD of Pike Township through remote learning; eLearning and students learning packets.
We will share any important news or updates via all of our communication channels (email, autodial, social media, website).
The Red Zone Food Pantry is open on Mondays, Wednesdays, and Fridays at the Pike Freshman Center from 11:00 a.m. -2:00 p.m.
Remote food sites for children 18 years old and under can be found on our updates page.

a.title: Click to read more about: Coronavirus Info

span.p: Monday, March 9, 2020: Online registration opens for PreK – 12th grade
Wednesday, July 15, 2020: 2020-2021 Middle School Onsite Registration (1:00pm – 7:00pm)
Tuesday, July 28, 2020: 2020-2021 High School Onsite Registration (12:00pm – 7:00pm)

a.title: Click to read more about: 20-21 Registration Dates

a.span: Family having breakfast Photo by National Cancer Institute on Unsplash

span.p: Next school year, for the first time in several decades, all Pike schools will operate on the same calendar. Having one common calendar will increase efficiencies and eliminate some operational and scheduling challenges. This change will not impact the school assignments of our current students. Eagle Creek, Fishback, and New Augusta North and South will continue as “lottery-based” schools. Applications for the upcoming school year will be posted on Friday, February 21, 2020.

a.title: Click to read more about: Lottery Based Schools Info

span.p: Due to our traditional and balanced calendars becoming more aligned, our School Board has approved a universal calendar that will begin in the 2020-21 school year. This fall, we surveyed staff, parents, and the community, which generated feedback for drafting a single calendar. The use of a universal calendar will increase efficiencies and eliminate some operational and scheduling challenges. It will not impact the school assignments of our current students. Eagle Creek, Fishback, and New Augusta North and South will continue as “choice” schools but with a curriculum concentration. The School Board will consider feedback from the district survey and focus group discussions as they finalize the concentration in the new year. Thank you for your patience, input, and support throughout this process.

a.title: Click to read more about: Academic Calendar Approved

span.p: At our school board meeting on Thursday, January 9th, I shared my concerns about the Indiana Department of Education’s current process for determining graduation rates. Additionally, I asserted my belief that the graduation rate that was publicized for Pike High School was inaccurate. As the Superintendent of Schools, I am unwilling to allow a flawed system to impact our high school, our district, and most importantly, our community.

There are several factors outside of our control that impact our graduation rate. For example, if a student withdraws from Pike High School and moves to another country, that student will be counted as a drop out unless we receive a transcript request. Our exceptional learners are counted as drop outs after 4 years even though we provide services until they are 22 years old. I was particularly frustrated by a situation we encountered this year, when students who left Pike High School to participate in another accredited opportunity such as Job Corp were considered drop outs and counted against our 2019 graduation rate even though we could prove they received an Indiana Diploma.

a.title: Click to read more about: HS Grad Rates Flawed

span.p: Mornings can be a stressful time. Getting ready for work. Getting your kids ready for school. Don’t send your child to the bus stop in severe weather. Instead, download our free innovative app to keep your children safer and make your morning easier. With Here Comes the Bus®, you and your child will receive alerts when the bus is near!

a.title: Click to read more about: Here Comes the Bus®
